definition: to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days
release from custody, subject to provision of a surety, pending investigation (PRC)

sentences.english: The accused was remanded in custody for a week.
He spent a week in custody on remand awaiting sentence.
sentences.chinese: 等候判決期間他被還押候審一個星期。

sentences.english: Mrs. Pojaman was convicted last month of tax evasion and released on bail.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫人上個月被認定犯有逃稅罪，交保候審。

sentences.english: The suspect was remanded in custody because someone who claimed to be a witness offered some new evidence.
sentences.chinese: 者的人提供新的證據，所以嫌疑犯被送返監獄候審。

sentences.english: Seven are under house detention while another three are out on bail, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 報道說，有七人爲監視居住，另有三人取保候審。

sentences.english: There'll be a remand, no doubt.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，會有還押候審。

sentences.english: Chapter II detailed analysis of floating population released on "difficult" reasons about the application of the bail pending trial with restricted liberty.
sentences.chinese: 第二章詳細分析造成流動人口取保候審“難”的原因。

sentences.english: The judge ordered that the prisoner should be remanded.
Tell county jail we're remanding him for trial.
sentences.chinese: 跟地區監獄說，把他關押候審。

sentences.english: Since it is the period of obtaining a guarantor and pending trial, his activities are restricted.
sentences.chinese: 因爲處在取保候審期間，所以他的行動受到限止。
